Dialogue.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogue.Text: The other T-Rex fighting for Diana's heart may have had strength and size on their side, but you figure that your small size and speed came in handy in the [air level name]. Those mountains are so hard to navigate, especially at such a high altitude, but the flowers you found up there really paid off. You haven't even left Homer's cave when Diana happens to wander in, and immediately brightens.

Dialogue.Speaker: Diana
Dialogue.Text: Hey Phil! I was just here to visit Homer. He told me you'd gone out again - you've been awfully busy lately! Were you out finding this new flower? It's beautiful! I really need to go and find some water to keep these alive. It's too bad so much of it's dried up around here now!

Dialgoue.Speaker: Homer
Dialgoue.Text: Homer hear there LOTS of water out in [water level name]. Homer not go there cause lots of mean dinos, but maybe Phil can look!

Dialogue.Speaker: Diana
Dialogue.Text: That sounds like it could be kind of dangerous... Have you ever beeen swimming before, Phil?

Dialogue.Speaker: Phil
Dialogue.Text: 1) It can't be so hard, right? 2) Uhm, aren't our arms a little short for that...?

Dialogue.Speaker: Diana
Dialogue.Text: If you say so... I'd still be careful.

Dialogue.Speaker: Diana
Dialogue.Text: Haha, you have a good point. Be careful, then!
